resources.string: This screen displays all songs and albums. All songs and albums are clickable. Also there is 3-dot menu on top right corner for other actions. I have used support desgn library and data binding library heavily in this app.
1. I will use Android Pay API to process payments.
2. For this I will first add dependency in project\'s build.gradle file.
3. Modification in manifest file is also needed for this api.
4. When the user clicks on Buy button first thing the app will check is if the user have Android Pay app installed.
5. If the app is installed, request a payment token. There are two types of token network token and payment gateway token.
6. Now to request wallet information I will create Masked Wallet Request.
7. WalletFragment is also needed to be added to automate the process of purchasing.
8. When user tap on Buy with Android Pay in the Wallet fragment a intent will start and result will be catched in onActivityResult() callback.
9. From that result we can determine whether the transaction was successful or not.
